instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01987: What is 820-01987? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_G3H_RTC: What is PP3V3_G3H_RTC? PP3V3_G3H_RTC Is one of the first rails that has to come on in order for the USB-C mux chip to be powered in the T2 chip Macbook Pros..
definitions.3V3_G3H_RTC: What is 3V3_G3H_RTC? 3V3_G3H_RTC Is an abbreviation of PP3V3_G3H_RTC which is one of the first rails that has to come on in order for the USB-C mux chip to be powered in the T2 chip Macbook Pros..
definitions.U6903: What is U6903? This chip is responsible for creating PP3V3_G3H in 2016-2018 model Macbook logic boards.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5V USB C, no liquid damage
threads.message:
this one has 5V on amp meter, i already replaced the two CD chips, no difference 
PPBUS is 12.3v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H_RTC</SIGNAL> is 0.8V though

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5V USB C, no liquid damage
threads.message:
Diode mode to ground at <SIGNAL>3V3_G3H_RTC</SIGNAL>?
Compare with good board.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5V USB C, no liquid damage
threads.message: Got 0.359 on the faulty board and 0.45 on a CPU dead board same model

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5V USB C, no liquid damage
threads.message:
Check <RESISTOR>R6910</RESISTOR>-13 and their traces.
Post <CHIP>U6903</CHIP> voltages.

threads.message: FIXED! <CHIP>U6903</CHIP> change solved it. you legendary legend you!
